SEARCH
Package sh.brane.core.crypto.hd

Class MnemonicWallet

java.lang.Object
sh.brane.core.crypto.hd.MnemonicWallet
All Implemented Interfaces:
Destroyable
public final class MnemonicWallet extends Object implements Destroyable
BIP-39/BIP-44 hierarchical deterministic (HD) wallet for Ethereum.

This class provides a secure, standards-compliant implementation of HD wallets following BIP-39 for mnemonic phrases and BIP-44 for Ethereum key derivation.

Security Considerations

  • Mnemonic phrases are highly sensitive. The phrase returned by phrase() provides complete access to all derived keys. Store securely and never log or transmit over insecure channels.
  • Phrase cannot be cleared from memory. Due to Java String immutability, the mnemonic phrase stored internally cannot be zeroed when destroy() is called. Keep wallet instances short-lived and ensure the phrase is not retained elsewhere in your application. Derived Signer instances are independent and can be held longer.
  • Passphrase adds security layer. Using a passphrase with fromPhrase(String, String) provides plausible deniability and protection against mnemonic theft. However, a forgotten passphrase means permanent loss of access.
  • Derived keys inherit wallet security. All Signer instances returned by derive(int) are backed by private keys derived from the mnemonic. Compromise of the mnemonic compromises all derived keys.
  • No key material in logs. The toString() method never includes sensitive data. Debug output is safe to log.

Usage Examples


 // Generate a new wallet with 12-word phrase
 MnemonicWallet wallet = MnemonicWallet.generatePhrase();
 String phrase = wallet.phrase(); // Save this securely!

 // Restore wallet from existing phrase
 MnemonicWallet restored = MnemonicWallet.fromPhrase(phrase);

 // Derive signers for different addresses
 Signer account0 = wallet.derive(0); // m/44'/60'/0'/0/0
 Signer account1 = wallet.derive(1); // m/44'/60'/0'/0/1

 // Use custom derivation path
 Signer custom = wallet.derive(new DerivationPath(1, 5)); // m/44'/60'/1'/0/5
Since:
0.3.0

  • Method Details

    • isValidPhrase

      public static boolean isValidPhrase(String phrase)
      Validates a BIP-39 mnemonic phrase.

      A valid phrase must have 12, 15, 18, 21, or 24 words from the BIP-39 English wordlist with a valid checksum.

      Parameters:
      phrase - the phrase to validate
      Returns:
      true if valid, false otherwise

    • generatePhrase

      public static MnemonicWallet generatePhrase()
      Generates a new wallet with a 12-word mnemonic phrase.

      Uses SecureRandom for cryptographically secure randomness.

      Returns:
      a new wallet with a freshly generated 12-word phrase

    • generatePhrase

      public static MnemonicWallet generatePhrase(int wordCount)
      Generates a new wallet with the specified word count.

      Uses SecureRandom for cryptographically secure randomness.

      Parameters:
      wordCount - number of words (12, 15, 18, 21, or 24)
      Returns:
      a new wallet with a freshly generated phrase
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if wordCount is not valid

    • fromPhrase

      public static MnemonicWallet fromPhrase(String phrase)
      Creates a wallet from an existing mnemonic phrase without a passphrase.
      Parameters:
      phrase - the BIP-39 mnemonic phrase
      Returns:
      a wallet backed by the given phrase
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the phrase is invalid
      NullPointerException - if phrase is null

    • fromPhrase

      public static MnemonicWallet fromPhrase(String phrase, String passphrase)
      Creates a wallet from an existing mnemonic phrase with a passphrase.

      The passphrase provides an additional security layer. Different passphrases will derive completely different keys from the same mnemonic, enabling plausible deniability.

      Parameters:
      phrase - the BIP-39 mnemonic phrase
      passphrase - the passphrase (empty string for no passphrase)
      Returns:
      a wallet backed by the given phrase and passphrase
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the phrase is invalid
      NullPointerException - if phrase or passphrase is null

    • derive

      public Signer derive(int addressIndex)
      Derives a signer at the specified address index using account 0.

      Uses the standard BIP-44 Ethereum path: m/44'/60'/0'/0/{addressIndex}

      Parameters:
      addressIndex - the address index (0 to DerivationPath.MAX_INDEX)
      Returns:
      a signer for the derived address
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if addressIndex is negative or exceeds maximum
      IllegalStateException - if the wallet has been destroyed

    • derive

      public Signer derive(DerivationPath path)
      Derives a signer at the specified derivation path.
      Parameters:
      path - the full derivation path
      Returns:
      a signer for the derived address
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if path is null
      IllegalStateException - if the wallet has been destroyed

    • phrase

      public String phrase()
      Returns the mnemonic phrase for this wallet.

      Security warning: This phrase provides complete access to all derived keys. Handle with extreme care - never log, display in UI without user consent, or transmit over insecure channels.

      Returns:
      the BIP-39 mnemonic phrase

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this wallet.

      For security, the mnemonic phrase is never included in the output.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a safe string representation

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Destroys the wallet by zeroing sensitive key material.

      This method zeros the master private key bytes and chain code. After calling this method, the wallet can no longer derive keys and isDestroyed() will return true.

      Note: The mnemonic phrase cannot be zeroed due to Java String immutability. For maximum security, minimize the lifetime of MnemonicWallet instances and ensure phrases are not retained elsewhere in memory.

      Specified by:
      destroy in interface Destroyable

    • isDestroyed

      public boolean isDestroyed()
      Returns whether this wallet has been destroyed.
      Specified by:
      isDestroyed in interface Destroyable
      Returns:
      true if destroy() has been called, false otherwise
